Text: Re Being helpful to the JudgeThe California State Parties will endeavor to have a list of issues from our perspective available soon We feel the need to be somewhat cautious about presuming a question is properly in issue if it has one supporter LGMCOM AM Just by way of a suggestion to make things a little bit more organized for Judge Birchmans conference and to respond to Joannes inquiry earlier today how about if each group or individual entity not filing as part of a group do the following prepare a one page outline not a brief just an outline of the issues that group had introduced in its testimony identifying the group and the witness for each such issue Later but not very much later more details under each outline heading will get filled in by you for the joint stipulation of issues put it on List Serv by midday Friday lets assume for this exercise that if you think its an issue it is an issue we can second guess one another later and refine the list of issues when we get together someone who is public spirited can then merge the lists into one editorially neutral outline Just a suggestion and no response is needed Larry Acker This email including attachments contains information that is confidential and may be protected by the attorneyclient or other privileges This email including attachments constitutes nonpublic information intended to be conveyed only to the designated recipients If you are not an intended recipient please delete this email including attachments and notify me The unauthorized use dissemination distribution or reproduction of this email including attachments is prohibited and may be unlawful
